newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 12.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Sri Lanka Navy attacks four LTTE (Liberation Tigers of Tami Eelam) boats, killing about 30 rebels, defence sources say. The Navy foiled an LTTE attack on Monday on northern Kankesanturai port.

Overall deficit of 34.8 billion rupees in the first six months of 1996 over the 1995 figure of 30.17 billion, was caused by war and drought, says recently released Central Bank interim report for 1996.

One coastal patrol craft of the Sri Lanka Navy was damaged and three soldiers were wounded, while 20 LTTE rebels were killed in clashes on land and sea on Monday, security sources say. Security forces are bracing themselves to face intensified attacks in view of the LTTE's martyr's week, which begins on November 20.
Navy repulses LTTE's Monday morning attack on northern Kankesanturai port and Karainagar military camp.
Police Special Task Force arrest 14 residents of Welikanda in the north central Polonnaruwa area, who had given shelter and information to LTTE rebels.
Four LTTE boats and 30 rebels killed in aborted attack on Kankesanturai harbour.
Police in Chilaw north of Colombo, detain a seargent and nine homeguards for allegedly assaulting a driver and passenger of a motor vehicle, on Sunday.
Navy repulses LTTE attack on northern Kankesanturai harbour.
Minister of Environment and Transport, Srimani Athulathmudali tells party supporters to stop using plastic for decorations, because it damages the environment.
